snippet: A rights group estimated that at least 135 executions have already taken place this year since the lifting of a moratorium on the death penalty in December.
abstract: Human rights groups are concerned about Pakistan's quick pace in executing death row prisoners since December 2014 removal of six-year moratorium on death penalty; figure estimated to be between 135-150 executions so far in 2015 is higher than any full year in a decade.
lead_paragraph: A rights group estimated that at least 135 executions have already taken place this year since the lifting of a moratorium on the death penalty in December.

headline.main: Pakistan’s Pace of Executions Alarms Rights Groups
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Pakistan: Pace of Executions Accelerates

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
